intro: Heptapleurum mangiferifolium, commonly known as the mango-leaf heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Vietnam, and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that resemble the shape of a mango leaf, hence its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that is typically edible and has a sweet, aromatic flavor.
